author: Paul J. Davies
title: Brexit Hits Bankers Where it Hurts: Their Wallets - WSJ
text:
If there is one group of people likely to be upset about Brexit, it is European bankers and fund managers who earned more than €1 million ($1.2 million) a year. There were about 10% fewer of them in 2016, the year when the U.K. voted to leave the European Union—not because of mass layoffs, but rather as a direct result of the falling value of the British pound, which lowered the value of their still lucrative payouts.
But there is no need to feel too sorry for them: in some ways it has never been easier to earn a fat payout....
